page.title: 02BODIAM CASTLE
page.content: Bodiam Castle attracts an annual average of 140 thousand visitors from Britain and other countries throughout the world. Up to 20 thousand school children visit this{ancient monument} during the course of a year. The castle, now 600 years old, with its outside walls and towers virtually intact, provides a useful background for{filming}. Examples are some episodes of "Dr. Who", and a programme in the "Watch" series on{television}; as well as a pop video for Adam Ant and a C.O.I. film about armour. A vital part of the castle's defence,the{moat}is a spring-filled pond, so although it has been known to freeze over, it would not be safe to walk on. At a cost of Â£1 for adults and 50p for children the castle is open to{invasion}every day except Winter Sundays.
